comments:
I was editing a java class when I got an error dialog with the message "An internal error occurred during: "Requesting Java AST from selection"."

Once the error dialog appeared, it would not go away - if I closed it, it would reopen.  I had to shut down eclipse.  Now it seems I can't use this workspace because the error dialog appears shortly after I start editing the class.

eclipse.buildId=I20051130-1215
java.version=1.4.2_03
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en
Framework arguments:  -showlocation
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -debug -clean -showlocation -clean


java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.JavaEditor.updateOccurrenceAnnotations(JavaEditor.java:2917)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.JavaEditor$6.selectionChanged(JavaEditor.java:2932)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.viewsupport.SelectionListenerWithASTManager$PartListenerGroup.calculateASTandInform(SelectionListenerWithASTManager.java:173)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.viewsupport.SelectionListenerWithASTManager$3.run(SelectionListenerWithASTManager.java:142)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Please provide that class otherwise it's hard to track this down.

Best would be to give us access to that blocked workspace.

Not that the "dialog" you see is not a modal dialog i.e. you can simply go and close the editor. But before doing so, please give us the workspace.

The class I was editing was Image.

I still have the workspace but it is no longer giving me this error.  I have since closed all the editors.
Does it come back if you open Image?

No.

I had the error occur three times.  I shut down eclipse, restarted it and the problem appeared shortly after I tried to edit the class.  Then the fourth time it stopped occuring.  I do not know what I did differently to stop it.

Reopening to close as dup.

Reducing severity:
- it is not blocking: the editor can be closed and then reopened - no need to 
  restart
- disabling occurrence marking removes the problem
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 117941 ***
